episodes.title: Former Prince Andrew Arrested By Police Investigating Epstein Files
episodes.description:
Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has been arrested at his home on King Charles' Sandringham Estate. 
Thames Valleys Police confirmed a man in his 60s was arrested by officers on Thursday.

Assistant Chief Constable Oliver Wright said: “Following a thorough assessment, we have now opened an investigation into this allegation of misconduct in public office.  

“It is important that we protect the integrity and objectivity of our investigation as we work with our partners to investigate this alleged offence. 

“We understand the significant public interest in this case, and we will provide updates at the appropriate time.”

Andrew Lownie joins Jack Royston to discuss the background to the misconduct allegations the police are investigating. The interview with Andrew Lownie was conducted before Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested.

episodes.title: Prosecuting Andrew Is King Charles' Only Way Out of Epstein Scandal
episodes.description:
Buckingham Palace said Monday that King Charles III would support British police as they assess reports that Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, formerly Prince Andrew, shared confidential information with convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

The statement followed confirmation from police that they are reviewing allegations that Mountbatten-Windsor sent trade-related reports to Epstein in 2010.

Thames Valley Police said it began examining the matter after media reports cited emails suggesting Mountbatten-Windsor provided Epstein with details from a Southeast Asia trade trip he took that year while serving as Britain’s special representative for international trade.

Representative Ro Khanna also said Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's friendship with Jeffrey Epstein could bring down the British monarchy and King Charles III "has to answer what he knew."

episodes.title: New Epstein Emails Shatter Andrew's Virgina Giuffre Story
episodes.description:
Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's most senior aide appears to have drafted a statement intended for Ghislaine Maxwell to release which said the former prince did meet Virginia Giuffre and had his photo taken with her—contradicting his later defence.
Andrew forwarded the message on to Jeffrey Epstein without contradicting the factual account, new emails containd in the Epstein Files and seen by Newsweek show. Andrew would later tell the BBC they had never met and that when the allegation first came to light he thought: "Well that's a bit strange, I don't remember this."
Yet, had the statement been published, it would have meant Maxwell had confirmed the meeting took place and, seemingly, also that the photo was real.
Andrew has always denied Giuffre's allegations. She sued him in 2021 accusing him of rape and he settled for an undisclosed sum while denying liability.

episodes.title: Ex Prince Andrew Exposed His Daughters to Epstein
episodes.description:
New Epstein Files emails show how Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, formerly Prince Andrew, and his ex-wife Sarah Ferguson gave Jeffrey Epstein  updates on their daughters. Ferguson also took Princess Beatrice and Princess Eugenie for lunch with Epstein while he was under house arrest. Both have always denied knowledge of his federal sex crimes.

episodes.title: Ex Prince Andrew Has a Second Epstein Accuser—and No Lawyer to Defend Him
episodes.description:
Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, formerly Prince Andrew, is facing a possible lawsuit from a second woman who says she was in her 20s when she was sent to Britain by Jeffrey Epstein for a sexual encounter with Andrew. Virginia Giuffre separately sued Andrew at civil court in New York and they settled for an undisclosed sum in 2022. Andrew has always denied the allegations and did not admit liability. Newsweek's chief royal correspondent Jack Royston and Graham Smith, chief executive of anti-monarchy campaign group Republic, discuss the long term implications for the Monarchy. King Charles reported helped Andrew cover the costs of the settlement with Giuffre—but would the public accept him doing so again?

episodes.title: Jeffrey Epstein's Sinister Power Move on Former Prince Andrew
episodes.description:
Jeffrey Epstein left what appears to be a four-year-old Buckingham Palace email out on a desk during a magazine shoot in 2015—long after his relationship with former Prince Andrew had left the royals mired in scandal, according to the photographer involved.

episodes.description:

episodes.title: Bombshell Police Statement on Former Prince Andrew
episodes.description:
Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, formerly Prince Andrew, will not be investigated by police over an email he sent in 2011 in which he asked a Metropolitan Police close protection officer to “dig up dirt” on his accuser, Virginia Giuffre.
